item.name: Altar's Light
item.text: Exile target artifact or enchantment.
item.flavorText: "The altar does nothing; the device is crushed under the weight of its own impurity." —Ushanti, leonin seer

item.name: Arrest
item.text: Enchant creature Enchanted creature can't attack or block, and its activated abilities can't be activated.
item.flavorText: "Unfortunately, it doesn't restrain the beast's smell." —Glissa Sunseeker

item.name: Auriok Bladewarden
item.text: {T}: Target creature gets +X/+X until end of turn, where X is Auriok Bladewarden's power.
item.flavorText: The Auriok have learned through constant struggle that allies are more precious than water.

item.name: Auriok Steelshaper
item.text: Equip costs you pay cost {1} less. As long as Auriok Steelshaper is equipped, Soldier and/or Knight creatures you control get +1/+1.
item.flavorText: They put their safety in his hands. He puts sharpened steel in theirs.

item.name: Auriok Transfixer
item.text: {W}, {T}: Tap target artifact.
item.flavorText: "My grandfather knew enough spells to fill a hundred scrolls. Nowadays, if a spell cannot fight the levelers, it is not even taught to our young."

item.name: Awe Strike
item.text: The next time target creature would deal damage this turn, prevent that damage. You gain life equal to the damage prevented this way.
item.flavorText: Stunned by the mere presence of the leonin kha, the nim raider quickly fell to its knees.

item.name: Blinding Beam
item.text: Choose one — Tap two target creatures; or creatures don't untap during target player's next untap step. Entwine {1} (Choose both if you pay the entwine cost.)

item.name: Leonin Abunas
item.text: Artifacts you control can't be the targets of spells or abilities your opponents control.
item.flavorText: Only leonin clerics who can survive the Razor Fields for one turning of the suns can stand in the Cave of Light.

item.name: Leonin Den-Guard
item.text: As long as Leonin Den-Guard is equipped, it gets +1/+1 and has vigilance.
item.flavorText: No one under the four suns can elude the watchful eye of the den-guard.

item.name: Leonin Elder
item.text: Whenever an artifact enters the battlefield, you may gain 1 life.
item.flavorText: "The wisdom of the elders is just as much a weapon as a sword or spear. We must learn to wield it." —Ushanti, leonin seer

item.name: Leonin Skyhunter
item.text: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
item.flavorText: The skyhunters were born when the first leonin gazed at the heavens and wished to hunt the birds overhead.

item.name: Loxodon Mender
item.text: {W}, {T}: Regenerate target artifact.
item.flavorText: The Auriok believe that in the hands of a loxodon, no weapon can be broken.

item.name: Loxodon Peacekeeper
item.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, the player with the lowest life total gains control of Loxodon Peacekeeper. If two or more players are tied for lowest life total, you choose one of them, and that player gains control of Loxodon Peacekeeper.

item.name: Loxodon Punisher
item.text: Loxodon Punisher gets +2/+2 for each Equipment attached to it.
item.flavorText: The loxodons believe punishment comes in two steps: pain and atonement. They carry a weapon for each.

item.name: Luminous Angel
item.text: Flying At the beginning of your upkeep, you may put a 1/1 white Spirit creature token with flying onto the battlefield.

item.name: Raise the Alarm
item.text: Put two 1/1 white Soldier creature tokens onto the battlefield.
item.flavorText: "The nim raid our homes without warning. We must defend our homes without hesitation."

item.name: Razor Barrier
item.text: Target permanent you control gains protection from artifacts or from the color of your choice until end of turn.
item.flavorText: "We protect our homelands. Why should they not protect us?"

item.name: Roar of the Kha
item.text: Choose one — Creatures you control get +1/+1 until end of turn; or untap all creatures you control. Entwine {1}{W} (Choose both if you pay the entwine cost.)

item.name: Rule of Law
item.text: Each player can't cast more than one spell each turn.
item.flavorText: Appointed by the kha himself, members of the tribunal ensure all disputes are settled with the utmost fairness.

item.name: Second Sunrise
item.text: Each player returns to the battlefield all artifact, creature, enchantment, and land cards in his or her graveyard that were put there from the battlefield this turn.
item.flavorText: The bright tunnel sometimes leads back to life.

item.name: Skyhunter Cub
item.text: As long as Skyhunter Cub is equipped, it gets +1/+1 and has flying.
item.flavorText: Every young leonin wishes to become a skyhunter, for they soar closest to the suns.

item.name: Skyhunter Patrol
item.text: Flying, first strike (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach, and it deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)
item.flavorText: "They are the first to raise the alarm when the levelers attack, and the first to risk their lives to defend the pride." —Raksha Golden Cub, leonin kha

item.name: Slith Ascendant
item.text: Flying Whenever Slith Ascendant deals combat damage to a player, put a +1/+1 counter on it.
item.flavorText: Instinctively drawn to the light of its "mother-sun," each slith follows that sun's path around Mirrodin.

item.name: Solar Tide
item.text: Choose one — Destroy all creatures with power 2 or less; or destroy all creatures with power 3 or greater. Entwine—Sacrifice two lands. (Choose both if you pay the entwine cost.)

item.name: Soul Nova
item.text: Exile target attacking creature and all Equipment attached to it.
item.flavorText: Within seconds, the nim was consumed in blinding sunfire. Afterwards, only a puddle of molten iron remained.

item.name: Sphere of Purity
item.text: If an artifact would deal damage to you, prevent 1 of that damage.
item.flavorText: Purity rejects artifice.

item.name: Taj-Nar Swordsmith
item.text: When Taj-Nar Swordsmith enters the battlefield, you may pay {X}. If you do, search your library for an Equipment card with converted mana cost X or less and put that card onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.

item.name: Tempest of Light
item.text: Destroy all enchantments.
item.flavorText: "This world reeks of another's hand. Someone or something is defying the power of the gods and shaping this planet. I intend for it to stop." —Glissa Sunseeker

item.name: Annul
item.text: Counter target artifact or enchantment spell.
item.flavorText: "Murder of the living is tragic, but murder of the idea is unforgivable." —Janus, speaker of the synod

item.name: Assert Authority
item.text: Affinity for artifacts (This spell costs {1} less to cast for each artifact you control.) Counter target spell. If that spell is countered this way, exile it instead of putting it into its owner's graveyard.

item.name: Broodstar
item.text: Affinity for artifacts (This spell costs {1} less to cast for each artifact you control.) Flying Broodstar's power and toughness are each equal to the number of artifacts you control.

item.name: Disarm
item.text: Unattach all Equipment from target creature.
item.flavorText: "Be thankful I left you your clothes."

item.name: Domineer
item.text: Enchant artifact creature You control enchanted artifact creature.
item.flavorText: Since they haven't seen their original master for millennia, golems are eager to take orders from anyone.

item.name: Dream's Grip
item.text: Choose one — Tap target permanent; or untap target permanent. Entwine {1} (Choose both if you pay the entwine cost.)

item.name: Fabricate
item.text: Search your library for an artifact card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library.
item.flavorText: "The secret to invention is to see something in your mind, then find where it hides in the world."

item.name: Fatespinner
item.text: At the beginning of each opponent's upkeep, that player chooses draw step, main phase, or combat phase. The player skips each instance of the chosen step or phase this turn.
item.flavorText: No one knows what she is watching, but she never takes her eyes off it.

item.name: Inertia Bubble
item.text: Enchant artifact Enchanted artifact doesn't untap during its controller's untap step.
item.flavorText: "I wouldn't want you to hurt yourself." —Bruenna, Neurok leader

item.name: Looming Hoverguard
item.text: Flying When Looming Hoverguard enters the battlefield, put target artifact on top of its owner's library.
item.flavorText: Although mute, hoverguards get their message across loud and clear.

item.name: Lumengrid Augur
item.text: {1}, {T}: Target player draws a card, then discards a card. If that player discards an artifact card this way, untap Lumengrid Augur.
item.flavorText: Information pumps like blood through vedalken society.

item.name: Lumengrid Sentinel
item.text: Flying Whenever an artifact enters the battlefield under your control, you may tap target permanent.
item.flavorText: The vedalken order their Neurok sentinels to watch over the shores of the Quicksilver Sea, as if they know of intruders yet to come.

item.name: Lumengrid Warden
item.flavorText: The Neurok, like the vedalken, are on a constant quest for knowledge. It is their currency, their trade, their life.

item.name: March of the Machines
item.text: Each noncreature artifact is an artifact creature with power and toughness each equal to its converted mana cost. (Equipment that's a creature can't equip a creature.)

item.name: Neurok Familiar
item.text: Flying When Neurok Familiar enters the battlefield, reveal the top card of your library. If it's an artifact card, put it into your hand. Otherwise, put it into your graveyard.

item.name: Neurok Spy
item.text: Neurok Spy is unblockable as long as defending player controls an artifact.
item.flavorText: From the murk of Mephidross to the heart of Kuldotha, the vedalken send their servants forth to gather knowledge from every inch of Mirrodin.

item.name: Override
item.text: Counter target spell unless its controller pays {1} for each artifact you control.
item.flavorText: "The Knowledge Pool has all the answers—especially ‘No.'"

item.name: Psychic Membrane
item.text: Defender (This creature can't attack.) Whenever Psychic Membrane blocks, you may draw a card.
item.flavorText: The vedalken always put their best thought forward.

item.name: Quicksilver Elemental
item.text: {U}: Quicksilver Elemental gains all activated abilities of target creature until end of turn. (If any of the abilities use that creature's name, use this creature's name instead.) You may spend blue mana as though it were mana of any color to pay the activation costs of Quicksilver Elemental's abilities.

item.name: Regress
item.text: Return target permanent to its owner's hand.
item.flavorText: "Once cast, a spell can be undone. But once revealed, a secret can never again be kept." —Pontifex, elder researcher

item.name: Shared Fate
item.text: If a player would draw a card, that player exiles the top card of an opponent's library face down instead. Each player may look at and play cards he or she exiled with Shared Fate.

item.name: Slith Strider
item.text: Whenever Slith Strider becomes blocked, draw a card. Whenever Slith Strider deals combat damage to a player, put a +1/+1 counter on it.
item.flavorText: A slith's form and function are determined by the color of the sun under which it's born.

item.name: Somber Hoverguard
item.text: Affinity for artifacts (This spell costs {1} less to cast for each artifact you control.) Flying
item.flavorText: The vedalken interrogate all intruders—once the hoverguards are done with them.

item.name: Temporal Cascade
item.text: Choose one — Each player shuffles his or her hand and graveyard into his or her library; or each player draws seven cards. Entwine {2} (Choose both if you pay the entwine cost.)

item.name: Thirst for Knowledge
item.text: Draw three cards. Then discard two cards unless you discard an artifact card.
item.flavorText: Lymph, the fluid essence of blinkmoths, is prized by wizards for the rush of intellect it provides.

item.name: Thoughtcast
item.text: Affinity for artifacts (This spell costs {1} less to cast for each artifact you control.) Draw two cards.
item.flavorText: Vedalken eyes don't see the beauty in things. They see only what those things can teach.

item.name: Vedalken Archmage
item.text: Whenever you cast an artifact spell, draw a card.
item.flavorText: "The Knowledge Pool knows. Memnarch understands." —Janus, speaker of the synod

item.name: Wanderguard Sentry
item.text: When Wanderguard Sentry enters the battlefield, look at target opponent's hand.
item.flavorText: Created by the vedalken to guard Lumengrid, the drones' empty eyes look beyond the Quicksilver Sea.

item.name: Barter in Blood
item.text: Each player sacrifices two creatures.
item.flavorText: "In the game of conquest, who cares about the pawns if the king yet reigns?" —Geth, keeper of the Vault

item.name: Betrayal of Flesh
item.text: Choose one — Destroy target creature; or return target creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield. Entwine—Sacrifice three lands. (Choose both if you pay the entwine cost.)

item.name: Chimney Imp
item.text: Flying When Chimney Imp is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, target opponent puts a card from his or her hand on top of his or her library.

item.name: Consume Spirit
item.text: Spend only black mana on X. Consume Spirit deals X damage to target creature or player and you gain X life.
item.flavorText: Mephidross changes all who dwell there, taking their lives and adding them to its own.

item.name: Contaminated Bond
item.text: Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that creature.) Whenever enchanted creature attacks or blocks, its controller loses 3 life.
item.flavorText: This leash disciplines the master.

item.name: Disciple of the Vault
item.text: Whenever an artifact is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, you may have target opponent lose 1 life.
item.flavorText: He stands in the shadow of his lord, Geth, drinking in the dark energies of the Vault.

item.name: Dross Harvester
item.text: Protection from white At the beginning of your end step, you lose 4 life. Whenever a creature is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, you gain 2 life.

item.name: Dross Prowler
item.text: Fear (This creature can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)
item.flavorText: "I would never have believed that on a world with four suns there could exist a place so dark." —Glissa Sunseeker

item.name: Flayed Nim
item.text: Whenever Flayed Nim deals combat damage to a creature, that creature's controller loses that much life. {2}{B}: Regenerate Flayed Nim.

item.name: Grim Reminder
item.text: Search your library for a nonland card and reveal it. Each opponent who cast a card this turn with the same name as that card loses 6 life. Then shuffle your library. {B}{B}: Return Grim Reminder from your graveyard to your hand. Activate this ability only during your upkeep.

item.name: Irradiate
item.text: Target creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn for each artifact you control.
item.flavorText: The blast ignores the cage of metal but devours the flesh inside.

item.name: Moriok Scavenger
item.text: When Moriok Scavenger enters the battlefield, you may return target artifact creature card from your graveyard to your hand.
item.flavorText: Many go to Mephidross in search of lost riches. Most end up as part of the cache.

item.name: Necrogen Mists
item.text: At the beginning of each player's upkeep, that player discards a card.
item.flavorText: Mephidross filled with roars of fury and wails of despair as the leonin fought to keep their memories from being pulled into the mists.

item.name: Nim Devourer
item.text: Nim Devourer gets +1/+0 for each artifact you control. {B}{B}: Return Nim Devourer from your graveyard to the battlefield, then sacrifice a creature. Activate this ability only during your upkeep.

item.name: Nim Lasher
item.text: Nim Lasher gets +1/+0 for each artifact you control.
item.flavorText: The rotting metal feeds the necrogen mists, and in turn the mists feed the nim.

item.name: Nim Shambler
item.text: Nim Shambler gets +1/+0 for each artifact you control. Sacrifice a creature: Regenerate Nim Shambler.
item.flavorText: Called "the Dross" by its inhabitants, Mephidross is home to the nim, Mirrodin's mindless, ravenous undead.

item.name: Nim Shrieker
item.text: Flying Nim Shrieker gets +1/+0 for each artifact you control.
item.flavorText: As imps they were an annoyance. As nim they are a pestilence.

item.name: Promise of Power
item.text: Choose one — You draw five cards and you lose 5 life; or put an X/X black Demon creature token with flying onto the battlefield, where X is the number of cards in your hand as the token enters the battlefield. Entwine {4} (Choose both if you pay the entwine cost.)

item.name: Reiver Demon
item.text: Flying When Reiver Demon enters the battlefield, if you cast it from your hand, destroy all nonartifact, nonblack creatures. They can't be regenerated.

item.name: Relic Bane
item.text: Enchant artifact Enchanted artifact has "At the beginning of your upkeep, you lose 2 life."
item.flavorText: A sword that has seen cowardice in battle exacts the price of honor from its wielder.

item.name: Slith Bloodletter
item.text: Whenever Slith Bloodletter deals combat damage to a player, put a +1/+1 counter on it. {1}{B}: Regenerate Slith Bloodletter.
item.flavorText: Goblins fear the slith, believing they are children banished from the womb of the Steel Mother, deep within Kuldotha.

item.name: Spoils of the Vault
item.text: Name a card. Reveal cards from the top of your library until you reveal the named card, then put that card into your hand. Exile all other cards revealed this way, and you lose 1 life for each of the exiled cards.

item.name: Terror
item.text: Destroy target nonartifact, nonblack creature. It can't be regenerated.
item.flavorText: "A simple trap in a dark corner of the mind, and their nightmares catch up with them." —Geth, keeper of the Vault

item.name: Vermiculos
item.text: Whenever an artifact enters the battlefield, Vermiculos gets +4/+4 until end of turn.
item.flavorText: Mirrodin's artificial environment requires its own predators, scavengers, and senseless forces of nature.

item.name: Wail of the Nim
item.text: Choose one — Regenerate each creature you control; or Wail of the Nim deals 1 damage to each creature and each player. Entwine {B} (Choose both if you pay the entwine cost.)

item.name: Wall of Blood
item.text: Defender (This creature can't attack.) Pay 1 life: Wall of Blood gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
item.flavorText: Blood is thicker than mortar.

item.name: Woebearer
item.text: Fear (This creature can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.) Whenever Woebearer deals combat damage to a player, you may return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.

item.name: Wrench Mind
item.text: Target player discards two cards unless he or she discards an artifact card.
item.flavorText: What is the sound of one head snapping?

item.name: Arc-Slogger
item.text: {R}, Exile the top ten cards of your library: Arc-Slogger deals 2 damage to target creature or player.
item.flavorText: A shuffling sound and the smell of ozone follow the slogger as surely as its electric tail.

item.name: Atog
item.text: Sacrifice an artifact: Atog gets +2/+2 until end of turn.
item.flavorText: On Dominaria, a scavenger. On Mirrodin, a predator.

item.name: Confusion in the Ranks
item.text: Whenever an artifact, creature, or enchantment enters the battlefield, its controller chooses target permanent another player controls that shares a card type with it. Exchange control of those permanents.

item.name: Detonate
item.text: Destroy target artifact with converted mana cost X. It can't be regenerated. Detonate deals X damage to that artifact's controller.
item.flavorText: The goblins have forty-two different words for "ow."

item.name: Electrostatic Bolt
item.text: Electrostatic Bolt deals 2 damage to target creature. If it's an artifact creature, Electrostatic Bolt deals 4 damage to it instead.
item.flavorText: It's hard to avoid electric shock when the entire plane is metallic.

item.name: Fiery Gambit
item.text: Flip a coin until you lose a flip or choose to stop flipping. If you lose a flip, Fiery Gambit has no effect. If you win one or more flips, Fiery Gambit deals 3 damage to target creature. If you win two or more flips, Fiery Gambit deals 6 damage to each opponent. If you win three or more flips, draw nine cards and untap all lands you control.

item.name: Fists of the Anvil
item.text: Target creature gets +4/+0 until end of turn.
item.flavorText: Gron's mind reeled with possibilities, most of which are best left unmentioned.

item.name: Forge Armor
item.text: As an additional cost to cast Forge Armor, sacrifice an artifact. Put X +1/+1 counters on target creature, where X is the sacrificed artifact's converted mana cost.

item.name: Fractured Loyalty
item.text: Enchant creature Whenever enchanted creature becomes the target of a spell or ability, that spell or ability's controller gains control of that creature. (This effect lasts indefinitely.)

item.name: Goblin Striker
item.text: First strike, haste
item.flavorText: There's no word in the goblin language for "strategy." Then again, there's no word in the goblin language for "word."

item.name: Grab the Reins
item.text: Choose one — Until end of turn, you gain control of target creature and it gains haste; or sacrifice a creature, then Grab the Reins deals damage equal to that creature's power to target creature or player. Entwine {2}{R} (Choose both if you pay the entwine cost.)

item.name: Incite War
item.text: Choose one — Creatures target player controls attack this turn if able; or creatures you control gain first strike until end of turn. Entwine {2} (Choose both if you pay the entwine cost.)

item.name: Krark-Clan Grunt
item.text: Sacrifice an artifact: Krark-Clan Grunt gets +1/+0 and gains first strike until end of turn.
item.flavorText: The more weapons a goblin breaks in battle, the more respected he becomes.

item.name: Krark-Clan Shaman
item.text: Sacrifice an artifact: Krark-Clan Shaman deals 1 damage to each creature without flying.
item.flavorText: "What do you mean, we're out of stuff to melt down? Give me your leg."

item.name: Mass Hysteria
item.text: All creatures have haste.
item.flavorText: The sooner you see the whites of their eyes, the sooner you'll spill the red of their blood.

item.name: Megatog
item.text: Sacrifice an artifact: Megatog gets +3/+3 and gains trample until end of turn.
item.flavorText: In an ironic bit of evolution, the megatog's dozens of teeth are mainly ornamental. It prefers swallowing things whole.

item.name: Molten Rain
item.text: Destroy target land. If that land was nonbasic, Molten Rain deals 2 damage to the land's controller.
item.flavorText: When the molten rains fall, entire landscapes melt and flow away in rivulets of fire.

item.name: Ogre Leadfoot
item.text: Whenever Ogre Leadfoot becomes blocked by an artifact creature, destroy that creature.
item.flavorText: When the goblins need more scrap for the Great Furnace, they simply let the ogres loose and follow in their wake.

item.name: Rustmouth Ogre
item.text: Whenever Rustmouth Ogre deals combat damage to a player, you may destroy target artifact that player controls.
item.flavorText: It has an iron stomach. Literally.

item.name: Seething Song
item.text: Add {R}{R}{R}{R}{R} to your mana pool.
item.flavorText: Vulshok mana rituals echo the day when the red sun burst through Mirrodin's surface to take its place in the heavens.

item.name: Shatter
item.text: Destroy target artifact.
item.flavorText: Days of planning. Weeks of building. Months of perfecting. Seconds of smashing.

item.name: Shrapnel Blast
item.text: As an additional cost to cast Shrapnel Blast, sacrifice an artifact. Shrapnel Blast deals 5 damage to target creature or player.
item.flavorText: From trinket to trauma.

item.name: Slith Firewalker
item.text: Haste Whenever Slith Firewalker deals combat damage to a player, put a +1/+1 counter on it.
item.flavorText: The slith incubate in the Great Furnace's heat, emerging on Mirrodin's surface only when the four suns have aligned overhead.

item.name: Spikeshot Goblin
item.text: {R}, {T}: Spikeshot Goblin deals damage equal to its power to target creature or player.
item.flavorText: The path of a goblin shaman is a journey through a thousand ways of hurting people.

item.name: Trash for Treasure
item.text: As an additional cost to cast Trash for Treasure, sacrifice an artifact. Return target artifact card from your graveyard to the battlefield.
item.flavorText: Goblins generally have two possessions: one per hand.

item.name: Vulshok Battlemaster
item.text: Haste When Vulshok Battlemaster enters the battlefield, attach all Equipment on the battlefield to it. (Control of the Equipment doesn't change.)
item.flavorText: "I could demonstrate how the leonin sunsplicer works, but then you'd be too dead to buy one."

item.name: Vulshok Berserker
item.text: Haste
item.flavorText: He experiences every emotion with passion and repays every slight with vengeance.

item.name: War Elemental
item.text: When War Elemental enters the battlefield, sacrifice it unless an opponent was dealt damage this turn. Whenever an opponent is dealt damage, put that many +1/+1 counters on War Elemental.

item.name: Battlegrowth
item.text: Put a +1/+1 counter on target creature.
item.flavorText: "I would gladly die for the forest, but I'm much better at killing for it."

item.name: Bloodscent
item.text: All creatures able to block target creature this turn do so.
item.flavorText: To study the predators of the Tangle, two people are required: one to watch from above, and one to run like hell.

item.name: Brown Ouphe
item.text: {1}{G}, {T}: Counter target activated ability from an artifact source. (Mana abilities can't be targeted.)
item.flavorText: In a strange twist of fate, one of the most annoying creatures in the multiverse was brought to the place where it could cause the most damage.

item.name: Copperhoof Vorrac
item.text: Copperhoof Vorrac gets +1/+1 for each untapped permanent your opponents control.
item.flavorText: Like all forest beasts, it lives by one rule: if there's no room to grow, make some.

item.name: Creeping Mold
item.text: Destroy target artifact, enchantment, or land.
item.flavorText: The deadliest force on Mirrodin isn't the largest organism—it's the smallest.

item.name: Deconstruct
item.text: Destroy target artifact. Add {G}{G}{G} to your mana pool.
item.flavorText: "Nothing in this world, not even magic, likes to be caged."

item.name: Fangren Hunter
item.text: Trample
item.flavorText: Big ones hunt the elves, so the elves hunt the small ones to keep them from getting big.

item.name: Glissa Sunseeker
item.text: First strike {T}: Destroy target artifact if its converted mana cost is equal to the amount of mana in your mana pool.
item.flavorText: "There's a secret at the heart of this world, and I will unlock it."

item.name: Groffskithur
item.text: Whenever Groffskithur becomes blocked, you may return target card named Groffskithur from your graveyard to your hand.
item.flavorText: It growls not to threaten, but to summon.

item.name: Hum of the Radix
item.text: Each artifact spell costs {1} more to cast for each artifact its controller controls.
item.flavorText: The elves learned long ago that anything left here slowly vanishes. Now it is a sacred site where the dead are laid to rest and where unnatural magic is erased forever.

item.name: Journey of Discovery
item.text: Choose one — Search your library for up to two basic land cards, reveal them, put them into your hand, then shuffle your library; or you may play up to two additional lands this turn. Entwine {2}{G} (Choose both if you pay the entwine cost.)

item.name: Living Hive
item.text: Trample Whenever Living Hive deals combat damage to a player, put that many 1/1 green Insect creature tokens onto the battlefield.
item.flavorText: In its center is a single red ant, a queen that regulates the hive's movements.

item.name: Molder Slug
item.text: At the beginning of each player's upkeep, that player sacrifices an artifact.
item.flavorText: Fortunately for it, Mirrodin is a plane without salt.

item.name: One Dozen Eyes
item.text: Choose one — Put a 5/5 green Beast creature token onto the battlefield; or put five 1/1 green Insect creature tokens onto the battlefield. Entwine {G}{G}{G} (Choose both if you pay the entwine cost.)

item.name: Plated Slagwurm
item.text: Plated Slagwurm can't be the target of spells or abilities your opponents control.
item.flavorText: Beneath the Tangle, the wurm tunnels stretch . . . wide as a stone's throw, long as forever, deep as you dare.

item.name: Predator's Strike
item.text: Target creature gets +3/+3 and gains trample until end of turn.
item.flavorText: If you hear it coming, you're not its prey.

item.name: Slith Predator
item.text: Trample Whenever Slith Predator deals combat damage to a player, put a +1/+1 counter on it.
item.flavorText: Born amid the molten metal of the Great Furnace, the slith have more than adapted to the perils of a metal world.

item.name: Sylvan Scrying
item.text: Search your library for a land card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library.
item.flavorText: One glimpse of an elf's home lasts her weeks away in the wild.

item.name: Tel-Jilad Archers
item.text: Protection from artifacts; reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
item.flavorText: They are extensions of the Tangle, stretching its vines into the furthest reaches of the sky.

item.name: Tel-Jilad Chosen
item.text: Protection from artifacts
item.flavorText: "It is my honor to keep safe Tel-Jilad's secrets, not to know them."

item.name: Tel-Jilad Exile
item.text: {1}{G}: Regenerate Tel-Jilad Exile.
item.flavorText: For his crimes, he was made to forget all the trolls' secrets. Now he knows only that he is outcast, but not why.

item.name: Tooth and Nail
item.text: Choose one — Search your library for up to two creature cards, reveal them, put them into your hand, then shuffle your library; or put up to two creature cards from your hand onto the battlefield. Entwine {2} (Choose both if you pay the entwine cost.)

item.name: Troll Ascetic
item.text: Troll Ascetic can't be the target of spells or abilities your opponents control. {1}{G}: Regenerate Troll Ascetic. (The next time this creature would be destroyed this turn, it isn't. Instead tap it, remove all damage from it, and remove it from combat.)
item.flavorText: It's no coincidence that the oldest trolls are also the angriest.

item.name: Trolls of Tel-Jilad
item.text: {1}{G}: Regenerate target green creature.
item.flavorText: "The secret of this world weighs upon us, and we have been shaped by time and duty to bear it."

item.name: Turn to Dust
item.text: Destroy target Equipment. Add {G} to your mana pool.
item.flavorText: Mirrodin's inhabitants must be prepared for anything—including suddenly being unprepared.

item.name: Viridian Joiner
item.text: {T}: Add an amount of {G} to your mana pool equal to Viridian Joiner's power.
item.flavorText: "The Tangle reaches out to itself constantly, forming new connections. We must follow its example."

item.name: Viridian Shaman
item.text: When Viridian Shaman enters the battlefield, destroy target artifact.
item.flavorText: Because the elves are so in touch with Mirrodin's nature, they understand best how to dismantle it.

item.name: Wurmskin Forger
item.text: When Wurmskin Forger enters the battlefield, distribute three +1/+1 counters among one, two, or three target creatures.
item.flavorText: It takes three weeks for a patrol of hunters to down a slagwurm. It takes just as long to make a single cut in its hide.

item.name: Æther Spellbomb
item.text: {U}, Sacrifice Æther Spellbomb: Return target creature to its owner's hand. {1}, Sacrifice Æther Spellbomb: Draw a card.
item.flavorText: "Release that which was never caged." —Spellbomb inscription

item.name: Alpha Myr
item.flavorText: First to charge, first to fight.

item.name: Altar of Shadows
item.text: At the beginning of your precombat main phase, add {B} to your mana pool for each charge counter on Altar of Shadows. {7}, {T}: Destroy target creature. Then put a charge counter on Altar of Shadows.

item.name: Banshee's Blade
item.text: Equipped creature gets +1/+1 for each charge counter on Banshee's Blade. Whenever equipped creature deals combat damage, put a charge counter on Banshee's Blade. Equip {2} ({2}: Attach to target creature you control. Equip only as a sorcery. This card enters the battlefield unattached and stays on the battlefield if the creature leaves.)

item.name: Blinkmoth Urn
item.text: At the beginning of each player's precombat main phase, if Blinkmoth Urn is untapped, that player adds {1} to his or her mana pool for each artifact he or she controls.
item.flavorText: The vedalken embed such urns in their living artifact creations.

item.name: Bonesplitter
item.text: Equipped creature gets +2/+0. Equip {1} ({1}: Attach to target creature you control. Equip only as a sorcery. This card enters the battlefield unattached and stays on the battlefield if the creature leaves.)

item.name: Bosh, Iron Golem
item.text: Trample {3}{R}, Sacrifice an artifact: Bosh, Iron Golem deals damage equal to the sacrificed artifact's converted mana cost to target creature or player.
item.flavorText: As Glissa searches for the truth about Memnarch, Bosh searches to unearth the secrets buried deep in his memory.

item.name: Bottle Gnomes
item.text: Sacrifice Bottle Gnomes: You gain 3 life.
item.flavorText: Reinforcements . . . or refreshments?

item.name: Cathodion
item.text: When Cathodion is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, add {3} to your mana pool.
item.flavorText: Cathodions repair the Great Furnace by soldering parts of themselves to the mechanism. Eventually, they become one with the machine.

item.name: Chalice of the Void
item.text: Chalice of the Void enters the battlefield with X charge counters on it. Whenever a player casts a spell with converted mana cost equal to the number of charge counters on Chalice of the Void, counter that spell.

item.name: Chromatic Sphere
item.text: {1}, {T}, Sacrifice Chromatic Sphere: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool. Draw a card.
item.flavorText: "As expected, this sphere's design reflects the colors of the four moons . . . plus another?" —Pontifex, elder researcher

item.name: Chrome Mox
item.text: Imprint — When Chrome Mox enters the battlefield, you may exile a nonartifact, nonland card from your hand. {T}: Add one mana of any of the exiled card's colors to your mana pool.

item.name: Clockwork Beetle
item.text: Clockwork Beetle enters the battlefield with two +1/+1 counters on it. Whenever Clockwork Beetle attacks or blocks, remove a +1/+1 counter from it at end of combat.

item.name: Clockwork Condor
item.text: Flying Clockwork Condor enters the battlefield with three +1/+1 counters on it. Whenever Clockwork Condor attacks or blocks, remove a +1/+1 counter from it at end of combat.

item.name: Clockwork Dragon
item.text: Flying Clockwork Dragon enters the battlefield with six +1/+1 counters on it. Whenever Clockwork Dragon attacks or blocks, remove a +1/+1 counter from it at end of combat. {3}: Put a +1/+1 counter on Clockwork Dragon.

item.name: Clockwork Vorrac
item.text: Trample Clockwork Vorrac enters the battlefield with four +1/+1 counters on it. Whenever Clockwork Vorrac attacks or blocks, remove a +1/+1 counter from it at end of combat. {T}: Put a +1/+1 counter on Clockwork Vorrac.

item.name: Cobalt Golem
item.text: {1}{U}: Cobalt Golem gains flying until end of turn.
item.flavorText: Centuries before the first tides of the Quicksilver Sea rose to meet each new sun, Mirrodin's light shone on the golems alone.

item.name: Copper Myr
item.text: {T}: Add {G} to your mana pool.
item.flavorText: The elves thought of the myr as minor threats, just as the myr thought of the elves.

item.name: Crystal Shard
item.text: {3}, {T} or {U}, {T}: Return target creature to its owner's hand unless its controller pays {1}.
item.flavorText: The vedalken know it is not of this world, so they know that this world is not the only one.

item.name: Culling Scales
item.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, destroy target nonland permanent with the lowest converted mana cost. (If two or more permanents are tied for lowest cost, target any one of them.)

item.name: Damping Matrix
item.text: Activated abilities of artifacts and creatures can't be activated unless they're mana abilities.
item.flavorText: The priests tried cursing it. The mages tried dispelling it. In the end, they all obeyed it.

item.name: Dead-Iron Sledge
item.text: Whenever equipped creature blocks or becomes blocked by a creature, destroy both creatures. Equip {2} ({2}: Attach to target creature you control. Equip only as a sorcery. This card enters the battlefield unattached and stays on the battlefield if the creature leaves.)

item.name: Dragon Blood
item.text: {3}, {T}: Put a +1/+1 counter on target creature.
item.flavorText: A single drop turns skin to scale and fist to claw.

item.name: Dross Scorpion
item.text: Whenever Dross Scorpion or another artifact creature is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, you may untap target artifact.
item.flavorText: They skitter out of the mists to consume fresh kill before Mephidross has a chance to corrode it away.

item.name: Duplicant
item.text: Imprint — When Duplicant enters the battlefield, you may exile target nontoken creature. As long as the exiled card is a creature card, Duplicant has that card's power, toughness, and creature types. It's still a Shapeshifter.

item.name: Duskworker
item.text: Whenever Duskworker becomes blocked, regenerate it. {3}: Duskworker gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
item.flavorText: At the setting of each sun, it emerges to clean Mirrodin's floor of the day's carrion.

item.name: Elf Replica
item.text: {1}{G}, Sacrifice Elf Replica: Destroy target enchantment.
item.flavorText: It hunts with unnerving ferocity.

item.name: Empyrial Plate
item.text: Equipped creature gets +1/+1 for each card in your hand. Equip {2} ({2}: Attach to target creature you control. Equip only as a sorcery. This card enters the battlefield unattached and stays on the battlefield if the creature leaves.)

item.name: Extraplanar Lens
item.text: Imprint — When Extraplanar Lens enters the battlefield, you may exile target land you control. Whenever a land with the same name as the exiled card is tapped for mana, its controller adds one mana to his or her mana pool of any type that land produced.

item.name: Farsight Mask
item.text: Whenever a source an opponent controls deals damage to you, if Farsight Mask is untapped, you may draw a card.
item.flavorText: It turns the adversity of the moment into the knowledge of a lifetime.

item.name: Fireshrieker
item.text: Equipped creature has double strike. (It deals both first-strike and regular combat damage.) Equip {2} ({2}: Attach to target creature you control. Equip only as a sorcery. This card enters the battlefield unattached and stays on the battlefield if the creature leaves.)

item.name: Frogmite
item.text: Affinity for artifacts (This spell costs {1} less to cast for each artifact you control.)
item.flavorText: At first, vedalken observers thought blinkmoths naturally avoided certain places. Then they realized those places were frogmite feeding grounds.

item.name: Galvanic Key
item.text: Flash {3}, {T}: Untap target artifact.
item.flavorText: A solution in search of a problem.

item.name: Gate to the Æther
item.text: At the beginning of each player's upkeep, that player reveals the top card of his or her library. If it's an artifact, creature, enchantment, or land card, the player may put it onto the battlefield.

item.name: Gilded Lotus
item.text: {T}: Add three mana of any one color to your mana pool.
item.flavorText: Over such beauty, wars are fought. With such power, wars are won.

item.name: Goblin Charbelcher
item.text: {3}, {T}: Reveal cards from the top of your library until you reveal a land card. Goblin Charbelcher deals damage equal to the number of nonland cards revealed this way to target creature or player. If the revealed land card was a Mountain, Goblin Charbelcher deals double that damage instead. Put the revealed cards on the bottom of your library in any order.

item.name: Goblin Dirigible
item.text: Flying Goblin Dirigible doesn't untap during your untap step. At the beginning of your upkeep, you may pay {4}. If you do, untap Goblin Dirigible.

item.name: Goblin Replica
item.text: {3}{R}, Sacrifice Goblin Replica: Destroy target artifact.
item.flavorText: It destroys with unthinking glee.

item.name: Goblin War Wagon
item.text: Goblin War Wagon doesn't untap during your untap step. At the beginning of your upkeep, you may pay {2}. If you do, untap Goblin War Wagon.

item.name: Gold Myr
item.text: {T}: Add {W} to your mana pool.
item.flavorText: The leonin thought of the myr as omens, never imagining the sinister fate they foretold.

item.name: Golem-Skin Gauntlets
item.text: Equipped creature gets +1/+0 for each Equipment attached to it. Equip {2} ({2}: Attach to target creature you control. Equip only as a sorcery. This card enters the battlefield unattached and stays on the battlefield if the creature leaves.)

item.name: Granite Shard
item.text: {3}, {T} or {R}, {T}: Granite Shard deals 1 damage to target creature or player.
item.flavorText: It's a piece of a world the goblins have never seen but would dearly like to blow up.

item.name: Grid Monitor
item.text: You can't cast creature spells.
item.flavorText: The vedalken protect the Knowledge Pool at any cost.

item.name: Heartwood Shard
item.text: {3}, {T} or {G}, {T}: Target creature gains trample until end of turn.
item.flavorText: Like all other relics, it was left on the Radix by the elves to be destroyed. Unlike all other relics, it persisted.

item.name: Hematite Golem
item.text: {1}{R}: Hematite Golem gets +2/+0 until end of turn.
item.flavorText: Centuries before the first peaks of the Oxidda Chain rewrote the laws of magnetism, the golems patrolled Mirrodin's featureless surface unhindered.

item.name: Icy Manipulator
item.text: {1}, {T}: Tap target artifact, creature, or land.
item.flavorText: A model of Mirrodin in both shape and spirit.

item.name: Iron Myr
item.text: {T}: Add {R} to your mana pool.
item.flavorText: The goblins didn't think of the myr at all, which allowed the myr to observe everywhere unhindered.

item.name: Isochron Scepter
item.text: Imprint — When Isochron Scepter enters the battlefield, you may exile an instant card with converted mana cost 2 or less from your hand. {2}, {T}: You may copy the exiled card. If you do, you may cast the copy without paying its mana cost.

item.name: Jinxed Choker
item.text: At the beginning of your end step, target opponent gains control of Jinxed Choker and puts a charge counter on it. At the beginning of your upkeep, Jinxed Choker deals damage to you equal to the number of charge counters on it. {3}: Put a charge counter on Jinxed Choker or remove one from it.

item.name: Krark's Thumb
item.text: If you would flip a coin, instead flip two coins and ignore one.
item.flavorText: "I can think of one goblin it ain't so lucky for." —Slobad, goblin tinkerer

item.name: Leaden Myr
item.text: {T}: Add {B} to your mana pool.
item.flavorText: The Moriok saw the myr as fellow scavengers, never knowing just who the myr were scavenging for.

item.name: Leonin Bladetrap
item.text: Flash {2}, Sacrifice Leonin Bladetrap: Leonin Bladetrap deals 2 damage to each attacking creature without flying.

item.name: Leonin Scimitar
item.text: Equipped creature gets +1/+1. Equip {1} ({1}: Attach to target creature you control. Equip only as a sorcery.)

item.name: Leonin Sun Standard
item.text: {1}{W}: Creatures you control get +1/+1 until end of turn.
item.flavorText: The commander tells the troops where to go, but the standard reminds them why they're there.

item.name: Leveler
item.text: When Leveler enters the battlefield, exile all cards from your library.
item.flavorText: Once a century, the levelers rip through every corner of Mirrodin, obeying the commands of an unseen master.

item.name: Liar's Pendulum
item.text: {2}, {T}: Name a card. Target opponent guesses whether a card with that name is in your hand. You may reveal your hand. If you do and your opponent guessed wrong, draw a card.

item.name: Lifespark Spellbomb
item.text: {G}, Sacrifice Lifespark Spellbomb: Until end of turn, target land becomes a 3/3 creature that's still a land. {1}, Sacrifice Lifespark Spellbomb: Draw a card.
item.flavorText: "Awaken that which was never asleep." —Spellbomb inscription

item.name: Lightning Coils
item.text: Whenever a nontoken creature you control is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, put a charge counter on Lightning Coils. At the beginning of your upkeep, if Lightning Coils has five or more charge counters on it, remove all of them from it and put that many 3/1 red Elemental creature tokens with haste onto the battlefield. Exile them at the beginning of the next end step.

item.name: Lightning Greaves
item.text: Equipped creature has haste and shroud. (It can't be the target of spells or abilities.) Equip {0} ({0}: Attach to target creature you control. Equip only as a sorcery. This card enters the battlefield unattached and stays on the battlefield if the creature leaves.)

item.name: Lodestone Myr
item.text: Trample Tap an untapped artifact you control: Lodestone Myr gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
item.flavorText: When necessary, myr can override and control any artificial object, as can their creator.

item.name: Loxodon Warhammer
item.text: Equipped creature gets +3/+0 and has trample and lifelink. (If the creature would deal enough damage to its blockers to destroy them, you may have it deal the rest of its damage to defending player or planeswalker. Damage dealt by the creature also causes its controller to gain that much life.) Equip {3} ({3}: Attach to target creature you control. Equip only as a sorcery.)

item.name: Malachite Golem
item.text: {1}{G}: Malachite Golem gains trample until end of turn.
item.flavorText: Centuries before the first branches of the Tangle gave shelter from the suns' cold light, the shadows of golems were Mirrodin's only shade.

item.name: Mask of Memory
item.text: Whenever equipped creature deals combat damage to a player, you may draw two cards. If you do, discard a card. Equip {1} ({1}: Attach to target creature you control. Equip only as a sorcery. This card enters the battlefield unattached and stays on the battlefield if the creature leaves.)

item.name: Mesmeric Orb
item.text: Whenever a permanent becomes untapped, that permanent's controller puts the top card of his or her library into his or her graveyard.
item.flavorText: A step in one direction is two steps away from another.

item.name: Mind's Eye
item.text: Whenever an opponent draws a card, you may pay {1}. If you do, draw a card.
item.flavorText: "Ideas drift like petals on the wind. I have only to lift my face to the breeze."

item.name: Mindslaver
item.text: {4}, {T}, Sacrifice Mindslaver: You control target player's next turn. (You see all cards that player could see and make all decisions for the player.)

item.name: Mindstorm Crown
item.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, draw a card if you had no cards in hand at the beginning of this turn. If you had a card in hand, Mindstorm Crown deals 1 damage to you.

item.name: Mirror Golem
item.text: Imprint — When Mirror Golem enters the battlefield, you may exile target card from a graveyard. Mirror Golem has protection from each of the exiled card's card types. (The card types are artifact, creature, enchantment, instant, land, planeswalker, sorcery, and tribal.)

item.name: Mourner's Shield
item.text: Imprint — When Mourner's Shield enters the battlefield, you may exile target card from a graveyard. {2}, {T}: Prevent all damage that would be dealt this turn by a source of your choice that shares a color with the exiled card.

item.name: Myr Adapter
item.text: Myr Adapter gets +1/+1 for each Equipment attached to it.
item.flavorText: "The simplest way to plan ahead is merely to be ready for everything." —Pontifex, elder researcher

item.name: Myr Enforcer
item.text: Affinity for artifacts (This spell costs {1} less to cast for each artifact you control.)
item.flavorText: Most myr monitor other species. Some myr monitor other myr.

item.name: Myr Incubator
item.text: {6}, {T}, Sacrifice Myr Incubator: Search your library for any number of artifact cards, exile them, then put that many 1/1 colorless Myr artifact creature tokens onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.

item.name: Myr Mindservant
item.text: {2}, {T}: Shuffle your library.
item.flavorText: It knows what you are planning, and does not approve.

item.name: Myr Prototype
item.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, put a +1/+1 counter on Myr Prototype. Myr Prototype can't attack or block unless you pay {1} for each +1/+1 counter on it.

item.name: Myr Retriever
item.text: When Myr Retriever is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, return another target artifact card from your graveyard to your hand.
item.flavorText: Mephidross gives up treasure easily . . . as long as you take its place.

item.name: Necrogen Spellbomb
item.text: {B}, Sacrifice Necrogen Spellbomb: Target player discards a card. {1}, Sacrifice Necrogen Spellbomb: Draw a card.
item.flavorText: "Forget that which was never known." —Spellbomb inscription

item.name: Needlebug
item.text: Flash Protection from artifacts
item.flavorText: Near Tel-Jilad, the Tangle is almost silent, save for the trolls' chants and the skittering of needlebugs.

item.name: Neurok Hoversail
item.text: Equipped creature has flying. Equip {2} ({2}: Attach to target creature you control. Equip only as a sorcery. This card enters the battlefield unattached and stays on the battlefield if the creature leaves.)

item.name: Nightmare Lash
item.text: Equipped creature gets +1/+1 for each Swamp you control. Equip—Pay 3 life. (Pay 3 life: Attach to target creature you control. Equip only as a sorcery. This card enters the battlefield unattached and stays on the battlefield if the creature leaves.)

item.name: Nim Replica
item.text: {2}{B}, Sacrifice Nim Replica: Target creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.
item.flavorText: It kills with unfeeling malice.

item.name: Nuisance Engine
item.text: {2}, {T}: Put a 0/1 colorless Pest artifact creature token onto the battlefield.
item.flavorText: All Auriok children know the tale, "Bolgri and the Long Day of Squashing."

item.name: Oblivion Stone
item.text: {4}, {T}: Put a fate counter on target permanent. {5}, {T}, Sacrifice Oblivion Stone: Destroy each nonland permanent without a fate counter on it, then remove all fate counters from all permanents.

item.name: Omega Myr
item.flavorText: Last to charge, last to fall.

item.name: Ornithopter
item.text: Flying
item.flavorText: Regardless of the century, plane, or species, developing artificers never fail to invent the ornithopter.

item.name: Pearl Shard
item.text: {3}, {T} or {W}, {T}: Prevent the next 2 damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn.
item.flavorText: Leonin folktales claim it was brought from beyond the sky by the first kha.

item.name: Pentavus
item.text: Pentavus enters the battlefield with five +1/+1 counters on it. {1}, Remove a +1/+1 counter from Pentavus: Put a 1/1 colorless Pentavite artifact creature token with flying onto the battlefield. {1}, Sacrifice a Pentavite: Put a +1/+1 counter on Pentavus.

item.name: Pewter Golem
item.text: {1}{B}: Regenerate Pewter Golem.
item.flavorText: Centuries before the first chimneys of Mephidross belched clouds of toxic gas, only the golems' movements stirred the air of Mirrodin.

item.name: Platinum Angel
item.text: Flying You can't lose the game and your opponents can't win the game.
item.flavorText: In its heart lies the secret of immortality.

item.name: Power Conduit
item.text: {T}, Remove a counter from a permanent you control: Choose one — Put a charge counter on target artifact; or put a +1/+1 counter on target creature.
item.flavorText: Never content, vedalken artificers continually tinker with their creations.

item.name: Proteus Staff
item.text: {2}{U}, {T}: Put target creature on the bottom of its owner's library. That creature's controller reveals cards from the top of his or her library until he or she reveals a creature card. The player puts that card onto the battlefield and the rest on the bottom of his or her library in any order. Activate this ability only any time you could cast a sorcery.

item.name: Psychogenic Probe
item.text: Whenever a spell or ability causes a player to shuffle his or her library, Psychogenic Probe deals 2 damage to him or her.
item.flavorText: The same devices sold as surgeons' tools in Lumengrid are sold as implements of torture in Mephidross.

item.name: Pyrite Spellbomb
item.text: {R}, Sacrifice Pyrite Spellbomb: Pyrite Spellbomb deals 2 damage to target creature or player. {1}, Sacrifice Pyrite Spellbomb: Draw a card.
item.flavorText: "Melt that which was never frozen." —Spellbomb inscription

item.name: Quicksilver Fountain
item.text: At the beginning of each player's upkeep, that player puts a flood counter on target non-Island land he or she controls of his or her choice. That land is an Island for as long as it has a flood counter on it. At the beginning of each end step, if all lands on the battlefield are Islands, remove all flood counters from them.

item.name: Rust Elemental
item.text: Flying At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice an artifact other than Rust Elemental. If you can't, tap Rust Elemental and you lose 4 life.

item.name: Rustspore Ram
item.text: When Rustspore Ram enters the battlefield, destroy target Equipment.
item.flavorText: Where herds have passed, the dented ground is lined with piles of rust.

item.name: Scale of Chiss-Goria
item.text: Flash Affinity for artifacts (This spell costs {1} less to cast for each artifact you control.) {T}: Target creature gets +0/+1 until end of turn.

item.name: Scrabbling Claws
item.text: {T}: Target player exiles a card from his or her graveyard. {1}, Sacrifice Scrabbling Claws: Exile target card from a graveyard. Draw a card.

item.name: Sculpting Steel
item.text: You may have Sculpting Steel enter the battlefield as a copy of any artifact on the battlefield.
item.flavorText: An artificer once dropped one in a vault full of coins. She has yet to find it.

item.name: Scythe of the Wretched
Serum Tank
item.text: Whenever Serum Tank or another artifact enters the battlefield, put a charge counter on Serum Tank. {3}, {T}, Remove a charge counter from Serum Tank: Draw a card.

item.name: Silver Myr
item.text: {T}: Add {U} to your mana pool.
item.flavorText: The vedalken saw the myr as toys, unaware of the intelligence lurking behind their empty eyes.

item.name: Skeleton Shard
item.text: {3}, {T} or {B}, {T}: Return target artifact creature card from your graveyard to your hand.
item.flavorText: Metal permeates the marrow of every bone in Mephidross—except one.

item.name: Slagwurm Armor
item.text: Equipped creature gets +0/+6. Equip {3} ({3}: Attach to target creature you control. Equip only as a sorcery. This card enters the battlefield unattached and stays on the battlefield if the creature leaves.)

item.name: Soldier Replica
item.text: {1}{W}, Sacrifice Soldier Replica: Soldier Replica deals 3 damage to target attacking or blocking creature.
item.flavorText: It fights with inhuman vigor.

item.name: Solemn Simulacrum
item.text: When Solemn Simulacrum enters the battlefield, you may search your library for a basic land card and put that card onto the battlefield tapped. If you do, shuffle your library. When Solemn Simulacrum is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, you may draw a card.

item.name: Soul Foundry
item.text: Imprint — When Soul Foundry enters the battlefield, you may exile a creature card from your hand. {X}, {T}: Put a token that's a copy of the exiled card onto the battlefield. X is the converted mana cost of that card.

item.name: Spellweaver Helix
item.text: Imprint — When Spellweaver Helix enters the battlefield, you may exile two target sorcery cards from a single graveyard. Whenever a player casts a card, if it has the same name as one of the cards exiled with Spellweaver Helix, you may copy the other. If you do, you may cast the copy without paying its mana cost.

item.name: Steel Wall
item.text: Defender (This creature can't attack.)
item.flavorText: "We sculpt the land into what we need—homes, armament, fortresses of war. Our strength comes not only from knowing, but from commanding the terrain." —Raksha Golden Cub, leonin kha

item.name: Sun Droplet
item.text: Whenever you're dealt damage, put that many charge counters on Sun Droplet. At the beginning of each upkeep, you may remove a charge counter from Sun Droplet. If you do, you gain 1 life.

item.name: Sunbeam Spellbomb
item.text: {W}, Sacrifice Sunbeam Spellbomb: You gain 5 life. {1}, Sacrifice Sunbeam Spellbomb: Draw a card.
item.flavorText: "Cure that which was never ill." —Spellbomb inscription

item.name: Sword of Kaldra
item.text: Equipped creature gets +5/+5. Whenever equipped creature deals damage to a creature, exile that creature. Equip {4} ({4}: Attach to target creature you control. Equip only as a sorcery. This card enters the battlefield unattached and stays on the battlefield if the creature leaves.)

item.name: Synod Sanctum
item.text: {2}, {T}: Exile target permanent you control. {2}, Sacrifice Synod Sanctum: Return all cards exiled with Synod Sanctum to the battlefield under your control.

item.name: Talisman of Dominance
item.text: {T}: Add {1} to your mana pool. {T}: Add {U} or {B} to your mana pool. Talisman of Dominance deals 1 damage to you.

item.name: Talisman of Impulse
item.text: {T}: Add {1} to your mana pool. {T}: Add {R} or {G} to your mana pool. Talisman of Impulse deals 1 damage to you.

item.name: Talisman of Indulgence
item.text: {T}: Add {1} to your mana pool. {T}: Add {B} or {R} to your mana pool. Talisman of Indulgence deals 1 damage to you.

item.name: Talisman of Progress
item.text: {T}: Add {1} to your mana pool. {T}: Add {W} or {U} to your mana pool. Talisman of Progress deals 1 damage to you.

item.name: Talisman of Unity
item.text: {T}: Add {1} to your mana pool. {T}: Add {G} or {W} to your mana pool. Talisman of Unity deals 1 damage to you.

item.name: Tanglebloom
item.text: {1}, {T}: You gain 1 life.
item.flavorText: Druids converted swaths of the Tangle into tanglebloom orchards. Though heavy tools are needed to cut a leaf in the Tangle, tanglebloom fruit is easily plucked by hand.

item.name: Tangleroot
item.text: Whenever a player casts a creature spell, that player adds {G} to his or her mana pool.
item.flavorText: As if there's glitch in the system, the Tangle sometimes folds in on itself, throwing off sparks of mana in a mystifying display.

item.name: Tel-Jilad Stylus
item.text: {T}: Put target permanent you own on the bottom of your library.
item.flavorText: Etched on Tel-Jilad's trunk is an entire history of Mirrodin—except for an expanse near the ground scrubbed smooth by an unknown hand.

item.name: Thought Prison
item.text: Imprint — When Thought Prison enters the battlefield, you may have target player reveal his or her hand. If you do, choose a nonland card from it and exile that card. Whenever a player casts a spell that shares a color or converted mana cost with the exiled card, Thought Prison deals 2 damage to that player.

item.name: Timesifter
item.text: At the beginning of each upkeep, each player exiles the top card of his or her library. The player who exiled the card with the highest converted mana cost takes an extra turn after this one. If two or more players' cards are tied for highest cost, the tied players repeat this process until the tie is broken.

item.name: Titanium Golem
item.text: {1}{W}: Titanium Golem gains first strike until end of turn.
item.flavorText: Centuries before the first blades of the Razor Fields chimed in the wind, Mirrodin echoed with the golems' footsteps.

item.name: Tooth of Chiss-Goria
item.text: Flash Affinity for artifacts (This spell costs {1} less to cast for each artifact you control.) {T}: Target creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn.

item.name: Tower of Champions
item.text: {8}, {T}: Target creature gets +6/+6 until end of turn.
item.flavorText: The ur-golem runes tell of the transformation of Mirrodin's warden from silent guardian to merciless god.

item.name: Tower of Eons
item.text: {8}, {T}: You gain 10 life.
item.flavorText: Its etchings tell the ur-golems' stories of an entity able to force life into a lifeless plane.

item.name: Tower of Fortunes
item.text: {8}, {T}: Draw four cards.
item.flavorText: The ur-golem etchings begin by celebrating Mirrodin's creator, a golem of almost limitless power. They end by cursing its protector, a being called Memnarch.

item.name: Tower of Murmurs
item.text: {8}, {T}: Target player puts the top eight cards of his or her library into his or her graveyard.
item.flavorText: Etched on its surface are warnings from a long-lost race of ur-golems pushed to the brink of extinction.

item.name: Triskelion
item.text: Triskelion enters the battlefield with three +1/+1 counters on it. Remove a +1/+1 counter from Triskelion: Triskelion deals 1 damage to target creature or player.

item.name: Viridian Longbow
item.text: Equipped creature has "{T}: This creature deals 1 damage to target creature or player." Equip {3} ({3}: Attach to target creature you control. Equip only as a sorcery. This card enters the battlefield unattached and stays on the battlefield if the creature leaves.)

item.name: Vorrac Battlehorns
item.text: Equipped creature has trample and can't be blocked by more than one creature. Equip {1} ({1}: Attach to target creature you control. Equip only as a sorcery. This card enters the battlefield unattached and stays on the battlefield if the creature leaves.)

item.name: Vulshok Battlegear
item.text: Equipped creature gets +3/+3. Equip {3} ({3}: Attach to target creature you control. Equip only as a sorcery. This card enters the battlefield unattached and stays on the battlefield if the creature leaves.)

item.name: Vulshok Gauntlets
item.text: Equipped creature gets +4/+2 and doesn't untap during its controller's untap step. Equip {3} ({3}: Attach to target creature you control. Equip only as a sorcery. This card enters the battlefield unattached and stays on the battlefield if the creature leaves.)

item.name: Welding Jar
item.text: Sacrifice Welding Jar: Regenerate target artifact.
item.flavorText: The wires crawl over broken metal and heat themselves to melting, filling cracks quickly and efficiently.

item.name: Wizard Replica
item.text: Flying {U}, Sacrifice Wizard Replica: Counter target spell unless its controller pays {2}.
item.flavorText: It responds with unnatural precision.

item.name: Worldslayer
item.text: Whenever equipped creature deals combat damage to a player, destroy all permanents other than Worldslayer. Equip {5} ({5}: Attach to target creature you control. Equip only as a sorcery. This card enters the battlefield unattached and stays on the battlefield if the creature leaves.)

item.name: Yotian Soldier
item.text: Vigilance
item.flavorText: Poets dream the verses of otherworldly stories. Artificers dream the blueprints of otherplanar artifacts.

item.name: Ancient Den
item.text: (Ancient Den isn't a spell.) {T}: Add {W} to your mana pool.
item.flavorText: Taj-Nar, throne of Raksha Golden Cub, destined leader of the leonin prides.

item.name: Blinkmoth Well
item.text: {T}: Add {1} to your mana pool. {2}, {T}: Tap target noncreature artifact.
item.flavorText: When dictated by blinkmoth migratory patterns, clouds of tiny lights well up from Mirrodin's core.

item.name: Cloudpost
item.text: Cloudpost enters the battlefield tapped. {T}: Add {1} to your mana pool for each Locus on the battlefield.
item.flavorText: "He watches from above. He watches from below. He watches from within." —Inscription on Tel-Jilad, the Tree of Tales

item.name: Glimmervoid
item.text: At the beginning of the end step, if you control no artifacts, sacrifice Glimmervoid. {T}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.
item.flavorText: An empty canvas holds infinite possibilities.

item.name: Great Furnace
item.text: (Great Furnace isn't a spell.) {T}: Add {R} to your mana pool.
item.flavorText: Kuldotha, wellspring of molten metal, temple of the goblin horde.

item.name: Seat of the Synod
item.text: (Seat of the Synod isn't a spell.) {T}: Add {U} to your mana pool.
item.flavorText: Lumengrid, site of the Knowledge Pool, source of vedalken arcana.

item.name: Stalking Stones
item.text: {T}: Add {1} to your mana pool. {6}: Stalking Stones becomes a 3/3 Elemental artifact creature that's still a land. (This effect lasts indefinitely.)

item.name: Tree of Tales
item.text: (Tree of Tales isn't a spell.) {T}: Add {G} to your mana pool.
item.flavorText: Tel-Jilad, sanctum of the ancient trolls, keepers of the secret of Mirrodin's origin.

item.name: Vault of Whispers
item.text: (Vault of Whispers isn't a spell.) {T}: Add {B} to your mana pool.
item.flavorText: Ish Sah, den of the warlord Geth, commander of countless nim.
